page.title: 18Dean Farm
page.content: It took us about ten minutes through the woods & then round two cornfields to reach Dean Farm. There was a very loud bird-scarer by the path that nearly deafened us. Mr Lingham met us. He lives there on his own with his sheepdog and some ducks. He & his father work 6 farms with 900 acres. Dean Farm is about 130 acres. Like all the others it is rented from the cement companies who own the land. Mr. Lingham grows barley, oats, wheat & grass for hay and silage. He makes silage in big plastic bags that hold half a ton. Some of the barley & oats are fed to the cattle. They have Hereford cross Fresians which they fatten up for market. In the winter they are kept in big barns. They have sheep which winter out. The cement company is planning to quarry chalk here soon-spoiling a beautiful valley.
